messages.content: What is the professor's contact email?
You can reach the professor at mccallun@uoguelph.ca.
Where is the professor's office located on campus?
Nicole McCallum's office can be found in MINS259.
How can I schedule a meeting with the professor?
You can arrange a meeting with the professor by making an appointment, available both in person and virtually.
Who teaches this course?
The course is taught by Nicole McCallum.
Which department offers this course?
The Marketing and Consumer Studies department offers this course.
How often should I log into CourseLink for updates?
It is best to log into CourseLink every day to check for any new announcements and updates.
What should I do if I encounter problems with MyLab access?
Contact Pearson support or the course instructor for help if you have issues accessing MyLab.
Is late submission of assignments allowed?
Late submissions are not accepted. There are policies for different types of assignments and flexibility built into the course structure.
Where can I buy the required textbook for the course?
You can buy the required textbook at the Guelph Campus Co-op Bookstore or the University of Guelph Bookstore.
What constitutes academic misconduct in this course?
Academic misconduct includes any form of cheating, plagiarism, or unauthorized collaboration. Ensure all your work is original and adheres to the University's academic integrity policies.
Which department is responsible for this course?
The Marketing and Consumer Studies department is responsible for this course.
What is the credit value of this course?
This course is worth 0.50 credits.
When can I meet with the instructor?
You can meet with the instructor by scheduling an appointment, either in person or virtually.
Where can I find updates and announcements for this course?
Updates and announcements can be found on CourseLink.
How should assignments be submitted?
Assignments should be submitted through MyLab MIS and CourseLink.
Is the course available online?
Yes, this course is available as an online distance education course.
Who should I contact for help with CourseLink technical issues?
For technical issues with CourseLink, contact CourseLink Support at CourseLink@uoguelph.ca or 519-824-4120 ext. 56939.
What type of questions are on the final exam?
The final exam will include a mix of multiple-choice and short answer questions.
What is the instructor's professional background?
Nicole McCallum has experience in international consulting for commercialization and economic development, and has been teaching at Lang since 2011.
What are the prerequisites for enrolling in this course?
The prerequisite for this course is MGMT*1000 with 4.00 credits.
What topics are covered in Week 0?
In Week 0, students should review the syllabus, assessments, and the introduction video on CourseLink.
What topics are covered in Week 1?
Week 1 covers Information Systems in Global Business.
What topics are covered in Week 2?
Week 2 covers Global E-Business and Collaboration.
What topics are covered in Week 6?
Week 6 covers IT Infrastructure and Emerging Technologies.
What topics are covered in Week 7?
Week 7 covers Databases and Information Management.
What topics are covered in Week 8?
Week 8 covers The Cloud.
What topics are covered in Week 10?
Week 10 covers Information Systems and Managing Projects.
What topics are covered in Week 11?
Week 11 covers Enterprise Applications.
How can I contact the professor?
You can contact the professor via email at mccallun@uoguelph.ca or visit her office at MINS259. Virtual meetings can also be arranged by appointment.
What is the office location of the professor?
The office of the professor is located in MINS259.
What is the email address of the instructor?
The instructor's email address is mccallun@uoguelph.ca.
What department offers this course?
This course is offered by the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.
What is the weighting of the simulation assignments in the overall grade?
Simulation assignments account for 12% of the overall grade.
Can simulation assignments be resubmitted for a better grade?
Yes, simulation assignments can be resubmitted multiple times based on the feedback received.
What learning outcomes do the simulation assignments cover?
The simulation assignments cover Learning Outcomes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 7.
Where can students access the simulation assignments?
Students can access the simulation assignments on MyLab.
Where can I submit my simulation assignments?
Simulation assignments can be submitted via the Simulation Assignments section on MyLab.
What is MyLab used for in this course?
MyLab is used for submitting assignments, conducting simulations, and accessing course resources.
How do students access MyLab?
Students can access MyLab through the links provided on CourseLink or directly via the Pearson MyLab website.
Can students access Pearson eText through MyLab?
Yes, students can access Pearson eText through the links provided in MyLab.
What should students do if they experience technical issues with MyLab?
If students experience technical issues with MyLab, they should contact Pearson support or the course instructor for assistance.
What are the key features of MyLab for this course?
Key features of MyLab for this course include personalized learning experiences, online homework/tutorials, assessments, study plans, contextual feedback, and a multimedia library.
How do I purchase the MyLab access code?
Purchase the MyLab access code from your school's bookstore website, following the instructions provided.
What should I do if I cannot find the 'Access Pearson' link on CourseLink?
If you cannot find the 'Access Pearson' link, ask your instructor for assistance.
How do I create a new account for Pearson products?
To create a new account for Pearson products, click 'Create', fill in your personal information, agree to the terms of use, and click 'Create account.'
What steps are involved in completing a grader activity in MyLab IT?
The steps for completing a grader activity include downloading starting materials, working on assignments on your computer, uploading the completed assignment, and submitting it for grading.
What should I do if I face difficulties accessing MyLab?
If you encounter issues with MyLab, try clearing your browser cache and cookies, refer to the troubleshooting page or FAQ, and contact Pearson support if the problem persists.
How can the Study Plan feature in MyLab benefit me?
The Study Plan feature creates personalized practice exercises based on your performance on homework and tests, offering guided solutions for unlimited practice to enhance your learning.
What should I do if I forget my Pearson account password?
To reset your Pearson account password, click on the 'Forgot username or password?' link and follow the provided instructions to recover your account.
Is there an option for temporary access to MyLab if I'm waiting for funds?
Yes, you can use a 14-day free temporary access code for MyLab if you are waiting for funds.
What are the main features offered by MyLab?
MyLab provides personalized learning experiences, online homework and tutorials, assessments, course resources, study plans, contextual feedback, and a multimedia library.
How can I request accommodations for a disability?
To request accommodations for a disability, contact Student Accessibility Services as early as possible to arrange the necessary support.
How will my participation in discussion posts be evaluated?
Discussion posts are evaluated based on your level of participation, relevance, thoughtfulness, and adherence to proper grammar and spelling.
What should I do if I miss an assignment deadline?
If you miss an assignment deadline, check the course policies for possible accommodations and inform your instructor if needed.
Where can I find extra study materials for this course?
Extra study materials, such as practice questions and summary slides, can be found on the companion website for the textbook.
Is it okay to work with classmates on Excel Assignments?
No, Excel Assignments must be completed individually. Collaboration is not allowed as these tasks are designed to assess your personal understanding and skills.
Can I discuss the Excel Assignments with other students?
You may discuss general concepts with classmates, but sharing specific solutions or collaborating on Excel Assignments is not permitted. Each student must submit their own work.
What is the policy regarding group work for Excel Assignments?
Group work is not allowed for Excel Assignments. Each assignment is intended to assess your individual ability to use Excel for data analysis and problem-solving.
In what format should I submit my Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments should be submitted as .xlsx files, following the specific instructions regarding file naming conventions and data presentation.
What is the intended goal of the Excel Assignments?
The goal of the Excel Assignments is to develop your analytical and problem-solving skills by applying Excel tools to various business scenarios.
How are the Excel Assignments graded?
Excel Assignments are graded automatically. You will receive immediate feedback and have the opportunity to resubmit your work to improve your score.
When are the deadlines for submitting Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments are due in Weeks 2, 4, 7, 9, and 11. Managing your time effectively is crucial to meet these deadlines.
What steps should I take if I can't access MyLab?
If you're unable to access MyLab, clear your browser cache and cookies, check the troubleshooting page, and contact Pearson support if the issue persists.
What does the Study Plan in MyLab offer?
The Study Plan in MyLab provides customized exercises based on your performance, helping you practice and master the course material with guided solutions.
How can I retrieve my Pearson account password?
To retrieve your Pearson account password, use the 'Forgot username or password?' link and follow the steps to reset your password.
Can I get temporary access to MyLab?
Yes, you can get a 14-day temporary access code for MyLab if you are waiting for funds.
What are the main benefits of using MyLab?
MyLab offers personalized learning, online tutorials, assessments, study plans, feedback, and a multimedia library to support your learning.
How can I arrange accommodations for disabilities?
To arrange accommodations for disabilities, contact Student Accessibility Services to discuss your needs and set up the necessary support.
What criteria are used to grade discussion posts?
Discussion posts are graded based on relevance, thoughtfulness, participation, and proper use of grammar and spelling.
What should I do if I miss a deadline for a quiz or assignment?
Refer to the course policies for missed deadlines and contact your instructor if you need accommodations.
Where can I find additional learning resources?
Additional resources, such as practice questions and summary slides, are available on the companion website for the textbook.
Can I collaborate with classmates on Excel Assignments?
Collaboration on Excel Assignments is not allowed. These assignments must be completed individually to evaluate your personal skills and understanding.
Is it allowed to work with other students on Excel Assignments?
No, working with other students on Excel Assignments is not permitted. Each student must independently complete their assignments.
Are group projects allowed for Excel Assignments?
Group projects are not allowed for Excel Assignments. Each student must complete their own work to demonstrate their individual abilities.
Can I talk about Excel Assignments with my classmates?
You can discuss general concepts but cannot share specific solutions or collaborate on Excel Assignments. Each student must submit their own work.
What are the rules for collaborating on Excel Assignments?
Collaboration on Excel Assignments is strictly prohibited. All work must be done individually to ensure academic integrity.
How should I submit my Excel Assignments?
Submit your Excel Assignments as .xlsx files, following any specific instructions regarding file naming and data presentation.
What is the main goal of the Excel Assignments?
The main goal of the Excel Assignments is to enhance your analytical and problem-solving skills using Excel in business contexts.
What is the process for grading Excel Assignments?
Excel Assignments are graded automatically. You receive immediate feedback and can resubmit your work to improve your score.
